intro: Actinolema, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they are often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Actinolema species are known for their ability to thrive in dry conditions, making them adaptable to various environmental conditions. They are also popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
